RT @damiacer: "Winter is getting closer ‚Äì we are now discussing with the countries how to get data into the system" ‚Äì Andrea Ammon, @ECDC_E‚Ä¶
RT @damiacer: We have all learnt from crisis, but since here the crisis is so big, we have to systematically learn ‚Äì Andrea Ammon #EHFG2020
RT @micheclb: Dr. Andrea #Ammon, @ECDC_EU clearly outlined where innovation could help addressing the #data challenge to improve response &‚Ä¶

We have always learned from crises. 

With a crisis of this size we need systematic learning. Collect information on what has been seen as challenges and see what we can standardize and digitalise.

#EHFG2020 https://t.co/BLXXgEHGDp

All the issues can be overcome.

E.x. we have seen an unprecedented field trial of the epi apps.

Testing something like this in peace times would take much longer, while now we get real-time experience and information on how to make them better suitable for our work.
#EHFG2020 https://t.co/1mPfk1uu0f

For winter we need to monitor other respiratory diseases, especially #influenza.

We need a proper protocol to get the data in the system ‚Äì to set capable monitoring of #COVID19 and #flu. It is important to have it uniform in all MS to have informed political decisions.
#EHFG2020 https://t.co/AX4ok08QY4

3rd challenge is the timeliness: you need the data in real time. What we get to see is an overview of the situation couple of days/weeks back. We need to facilitate these challenges with new solutions.

#ECDC Director Andrea Ammon at #EHFG2020 https://t.co/ZKqdBorEMK

2nd challenge is the lack of standards for the data that goes to the system.

This is depending on the testing regime and other factors. The data is used for far-reaching policy decisions (border closures, travel advice etc.), it needs to be comparable.

#EHFG2020 https://t.co/guDhMPBykA

There are lots of challenges with #COVID19 data. #Surveillance is the backbone of prevention and control of the infectious diseases.

Data you get depend on the system you design. Before you design the system you need to know what you want to do with the data.
#EHFG2020 https://t.co/DdCbW7nHGS

Proper #PhysicalDistancing, ventillation and cleaning, practising #HandHygiene, cough etiquette and personal protection (#facemasks etc.) will minimise risk of #COVID19 and other respiratory infections at schools.

https://t.co/RCzJ0Ougiy https://t.co/PTMQB53x39

Closures of childcare and educational institutions are unlikely to be an effective single control measure for transmission of #COVID19. Closures would be unlikely to provide significant additional protection of kids' health, since most develop a very mild form of COVID-19, if any https://t.co/rtQly8OgGa

Kids are more likely to have a mild or asymptomatic infection.

When symptomatic, children shed virus in similar quantities to adults and can infect others in a similar way to adults.

It is unknown how infectious asymptomatic children are.
https://t.co/RCzJ0Ougiy https://t.co/6I8ZwbVDRm

What is the role of children in #COVID19 transmission?
Should schools be considered as more dangerous public spaces?

We have #JustPublished a report on the current level of knowledge on children and #COVID19 infection.

RT @EUInterpreters: Interpretation is all about paying attention to thoughts, tones, terms, words, letters and numbers. 

Hepatitis A, B, C‚Ä¶

RT @EU_Health: #WorldHepatitisDay

Millions of people are unaware they have hepatitis, but much can be done:

‚úÖPreventative vaccinations
‚úÖT‚Ä¶

Only a few countries have met the 2020 target of the European Action Plan to diagnose 50% of people with chronic hepatitis.

Mortality is high & there is little evidence of progress towards the 2030 elimination target of a 65% against the 2015 baseline.

https://t.co/TwygBnqK4o https://t.co/dx7V2XEe74

You can get the most recent data on #HepatitisA in Europe here:

https://t.co/s1G3oUYv7f

#WorldHepatitisDay #WorldHepatitisDay2020 https://t.co/bhmbiEalT2

Early diagnosis and linkage to care bring strong individual and public health benefits: effective viral #hepatitis treatment either eliminates or suppresses the viruses significantly.

This also means that those on treatment prevent further transmission!

https://t.co/TwygBn98FO

"(...) We are not on track to reach the 2030 target. Europe needs to massively scale up efforts to reduce the number of people who have never been tested for hepatitis B and C (...)" - says #ECDC Director - Dr Andrea Ammon on #WorldHepatitisDay #SDGs #WorldHepatitisDay2020 https://t.co/l7nPHc0PQM

Surveillance data show ongoing transmission of #HepatitisB & high levels of #HepatitisC diagnoses.

Targeted testing to reach those most at-risk of infection is essential for any strategy for a #HepFreeFuture!
#WorldHepatitisDay

Monitoring report https://t.co/H2cbMuIGnz https://t.co/OuMgdbuVpo

#WorldHepatitisDay

Around 4 in 5 people living with #hepatitisB & 3 out of 4 people with #hepatitisC in the EU/EEA haven't yet been diagnosed!

It's as simple as that: people need to know their status to make progress towards the #SDG by 2030
https://t.co/TwygBn98FO https://t.co/yclcZZh6d3
